video.title: The Agile Manifesto - Agile Software Development
video.description:
The Agile Manifesto describes the fundamental values upon which every Agile framework rests. In this brief video, you’ll learn what the full Agile Manifesto is, along with a little history of how it was created.

Video by Agile Coach Chris Gagné: https://chrisgagne.com/

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: bearded_mucassi
topLevelComment.text: which items are on the left again?

replies.author: NaN
replies.text:
1. Individuals and interactions
2. Working software
3. Customer collaboration
4. Responding to change

topLevelComment.author: Brian Hackit
topLevelComment.text:
can i ask a questuon here?
is this something thats well know in the industry?
like, its not a secret right?

replies.author: Armandt Roodt
replies.text: @Chris Gagné "make the teams do that Agile thing"... Excellent summary

replies.author: Chris Gagné
replies.text: It's not a secret (it's been published at http://agilemanifesto.org for over 16 years), but it's rare to see companies actually living these values. Mostly there's a focus on "making teams do that Agile thing," which of course isn't the point.

replies.author: Ilozulu Chris
replies.text: It is not a secret of some sort
